channel.title: Port Forwarding Problem
channel.description:
I've been having some problems regarding Port Forwarding.
I get my internet via the Phone Line which goes to a Linksys Phone Adapter+Router (Model No. SPA2102) which sends it to a Linksys WRT54GS router and a Westell Bellsouth B90-220030-04. The WRT54GS sends it to another Linksys Broadband Adapter (Model No. RTP300)
I guess I have to forward the ports on the SPA2102 and the WRT54GS? I already forwarded it on the WRT54GS, I tried forwarding the SPA2102 but I cant access it because 192.168.0.1 leads to the WRT54GS.
Help is appreciated. :)

item.title: Port Forwarding Problem
item.dc:creator: @FastBallz FastBawlz
item.description:
@FastBallz wrote:

I think I figured out my problems.

I connect my computer to the SPA2102 directly, got the IP, used DMZ to forward all the ports to that IP, connected the SPA2102 back to the WRT54GS, forwarded the ports I wanted on the WRT54GS and whalah, done.

Read full topic

item.description:
@ilyaostr9 wrote:

Do you have forwarding voids?

Sorry, I just had to <3

item.title: Port Forwarding Problem
item.dc:creator: @teh_spede Teh Spede
item.description:
@teh_spede wrote:

If you really need to forward the ports of two “routers” you might need this: http://portforward.com/help/doublerouterportforwarding.htm

Read full topic
